benchmark_details.name: CEAMC (Chinese Essay Argument Mining Corpus)
benchmark_details.overview: The CEAMC is a comprehensive multi-task dataset designed for understanding argumentation in Chinese high school students' essays, focusing on argument component detection, relation prediction, and automated essay grading.
benchmark_details.data_type: argumentative essays with annotated argument components and relations

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance understanding of argumentative structures and quality assessment in educational contexts through fine-grained argument annotations.

data.source: Chinese high school examination essays, annotated with argument components and relations.
data.annotation: Manual annotations by experts specializing in linguistics and education.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on matches between predicted and gold standard argument components and relations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better model performance in predicting argument components and relations.
methodology.validation: Cohenâ€™s kappa used to measure Inter-Annotator Agreement for argument unit boundaries and relations.
